title: A watch is sold at a profit of 30%. Had it been sold for Rs. 80 less, there would have been a loss of 10%. What is the cost price in rupees? - Quora

response.answer_text: The cost price of the watch be w. To gain 30% profit the selling price should be w+30w/100=w+3w/10=13w/10. Again w-10w/100=13w/10-80=(13w-800)/10 is the selling price when the loss is 10%. So 9w/10=13w/10-80, or 4w/10=80,or w/10=20. The cost price of the watch will be w=10×20=Rs.200.00

Let C denotes the cost-price in rupees. Let S denotes the sell-price with 30% profit. According to given data we have, S = (1 + 0.30) * C = 1.3 * C …… (1) S - 80 = (1 - 0.10) * C = 0.90 * C or 1.3C - 80 = 0.9C {from (1)] or 0.4C = 80 or C = 200 (rupees) [Ans]
